title: 108_hr5226
content: SECTION 1. CROP DISASTER ASSISTANCE. In this section, definitions are provided for terms like additional coverage, insurable commodity, and noninsurable commodity related to agricultural insurance. The Secretary of Agriculture is authorized to use funds for emergency financial assistance to producers, bypassing certain restrictions under the Federal Crop Insurance Act. The Secretary of Agriculture can provide emergency financial assistance to producers on a farm who have suffered crop losses due to weather conditions in 2003 or 2004. The assistance will be administered similarly to a previous act, with specific loss thresholds for quantity and quality losses. Producers who did not obtain insurance for their crops are ineligible for assistance. The Secretary of Agriculture can offer emergency financial aid to farmers who experienced crop losses due to weather conditions in 2003 or 2004. To qualify for assistance, farmers must have insurance for insurable crops or file paperwork and pay fees for noninsurable crops. The Secretary can waive these requirements if farmers agree to obtain insurance or file paperwork for future crops. The Secretary of Agriculture can provide financial aid to farmers for crop losses due to weather conditions in 2003 or 2004. Farmers must have insurance for insurable crops or file paperwork and pay fees for noninsurable crops for the next 2 crops. Violation of the contract requires reimbursement to the Secretary. Payment limitations apply, not exceeding 95% of the crop's value without losses. The Secretary can provide financial aid to farmers for crop losses due to weather conditions in 2003 or 2004. Payment limitations apply, including crop insurance payments and the value of crops not lost. Assistance may be reduced if the producer receives aid from Florida Disaster Programs. SEC. 2. LIVESTOCK ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide emergency financial assistance for livestock losses in designated counties for either 2003 or 2004. The assistance will be administered similarly to the American Indian livestock program. Eligibility for payments will not penalize producers. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide emergency financial assistance for livestock losses in designated counties for either 2003 or 2004. Eligibility for payments under the livestock assistance program will not penalize producers who take actions to reduce their livestock numbers due to disaster conditions. The Secretary of Agriculture will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to provide assistance for tree losses during the specified period. An additional $15,000,000 will be allocated for reimbursement to eligible forest landowners who have suffered tree losses. The Secretary of Agriculture will allocate an additional $50,000,000 from the Commodity Credit Corporation for the Emergency Conservation Program to assist participants with the maximum cost share percentage. The Commodity Credit Corporation will be utilized to implement this Act, and regulations will be established accordingly. The Secretary of Agriculture will utilize the funds, facilities, and authorities of the Commodity Credit Corporation to implement the Act. Regulations necessary for the Act's implementation may be promulgated by the Secretary without following certain provisions. Additionally, the Secretary will use the authority provided under section 808 of title 5, United States Code for Congressional review of agency rulemaking. SEC. 7. OFFSET. Amends Section 1241(a)(3) of the Food Security Act of 1985 to allocate $6,037,000,000 for fiscal years 2005 through 2014.
